definitions: A town in southeast England, in Berkshire, on the River Thames. It is the site of Windsor Castle, a royal residence.
A royal house of the United Kingdom, which came into being in 1917 when the family name was changed from Saxe-Coburg-Gotha.
A city in southwest Ontario, Canada, on the Detroit River, opposite Detroit, Michigan.
examples: Windsor Castle is a popular tourist attraction.
The House of Windsor has a long history.
She visited Windsor, Ontario last summer.
